page.title: 11EVENTS
page.content: The estate Residents Association have for some time been concerned about the view of the estate held by the town population. They have felt that the name Boycott Farm has not helped. Local representations were made following a poll of the residents to have the name of the estate changed. The town council agreed after protracted efforts and this was finally ratified by the Wychavon Council. The name chosen was Westlands Estate. It took much further effort to have road signs etc changed and there was considerable disagreement about the funding of the new signs. A solution was found involving the Town Council, the District Council and the County Council.
